10  package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.strategies.eclipse;
11  
12  import java.util.SortedSet;
13  import java.util.TreeSet;
14  
15  import org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair;
16  import org.junit.Assert;
17  import org.junit.BeforeClass;
18  import org.junit.Test;
19  
20  import de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.exceptions.CannotLoadConfigurationException;
21  import de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.exceptions.ProfileNotFoundException;
22  import de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.exceptions.ConfigReadException;
23  import de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.ui.options.Settings;
24  
25  /**
26   *
27   * @author markiewb
28   * @author bahlef
29   */
30  public class EclipseFormatterTest {
31  	private static EclipseFormatter instance;
32  
33  	@BeforeClass
34  	public static void setUpClass() {
35  		instance = new EclipseFormatter();
36  	}
37  
38  	@Test
39  	public void testFormatUsingXML() {
40  		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {A,B,C}";
41  		final String expected = "package foo;\n"
42  				+ "\n"
43  				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n"
44  				+ "			       A,\n"
45  				+ "				   B,\n"
46  				+ "				   C\n"
47  				+ "}";
48  
49  		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/formattersampleeclipse.xml", "eclipse-demo", text, null, null, null);
50  		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual.replaceAll("\r", ""));
51  	}
52  
53  	@Test
54  	public void testFormatUsingXML_formatterOnOff() {
55  		final String text = "package foo; public class NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n" +
56  				"\n" +
57  				"// @formatter:off\n" +
58  				"public void doSomething(String arg) {\n" +
59  				"	System.out.println(\"Hello World\");\n" +
60  				"}\n" +
61  				"// @formatter:on\n" +
62  				"\n" +
63  				"public boolean doSomethingElse(Object obj) { return false; } }";
64  		final String expected = "package foo;\n" +
65  				"\n" +
66  				"public class NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n" +
67  				"\n" +
68  				"// @formatter:off\n" +
69  				"public void doSomething(String arg) {\n" +
70  				"	System.out.println(\"Hello World\");\n" +
71  				"}\n" +
72  				"// @formatter:on\n" +
73  				"\n" +
74  				"    public boolean doSomethingElse(Object obj) {\n" +
75  				"	return false;\n" +
76  				"    }\n" +
77  				"}";
78  
79  		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/formatteronoffsampleeclipse.xml", "eclipse-demo", text, null, null, null);
80  		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual.replaceAll("\r", ""));
81  	}
82  
83  	@Test
84  	public void testFormatUsingEPF() {
85  		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
86  		final String expected = "package foo;\n"
87  				+ "\n"
88  				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n"
89  				+ "			       A,\n"
90  				+ "				   B,\n"
91  				+ "				   C\n"
92  				+ "}";
93  
94  		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/mechanic-formatter.epf", null, text, null, null, null);
95  		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual.replaceAll("\r", ""));
96  	}
97  
98  	@Test
99  	public void testFormatUsingProjectSettings() {
100 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
101 		final String expected = "package foo;\n"
102 				+ "\n"
103 				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n"
104 				+ "			       A,\n"
105 				+ "				   B,\n"
106 				+ "				   C\n"
107 				+ "}";
108 
109 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, null, null, null);
110 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual.replaceAll("\r", ""));
111 	}
112 
113 	/**
114 	 * https://github.com/markiewb/eclipsecodeformatter_for_netbeans/issues/77
115 	 */
116 	@Test
117 	public void testFormatUsingProjectSettings_ExplicitDefaultFormatter() {
118 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
119 		final String expected = "package foo;\n"
120 				+ "\n"
121 				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n"
122 				+ "			       A,\n"
123 				+ "				   B,\n"
124 				+ "				   C\n"
125 				+ "}";
126 
127 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/defaultformatter_org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, null, null, null);
128 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual.replaceAll("\r", ""));
129 	}
130 
131 	/**
132 	 * https://github.com/markiewb/eclipsecodeformatter_for_netbeans/issues/77
133 	 */
134 	@Test
135 	public void testFormatUsingProjectSettings_Explicit3rdPartyFormatter_Failure() {
136 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
137 
138 		try {
139 			instance.format("src/test/resources/3rdPartyFormatter_org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, null, null, null);
140 		} catch (Exception e) {
141 			Assert.assertEquals(true, e.getMessage().contains("The use of third-party Java code formatters is not supported by this plugin."));
142 		}
143 	}
144 
145 	@Test
146 	public void testFormatUsingLinefeed_CR() {
147 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
148 		final String expected = "package foo;\r"
149 				+ "\r"
150 				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\r"
151 				+ "			       A,\r"
152 				+ "				   B,\r"
153 				+ "				   C\r"
154 				+ "}";
155 
156 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, Settings.getLineFeed("\\r", System.getProperty("line.separator")), null, null);
157 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
158 	}
159 
160 	@Test
161 	public void testFormatUsingLinefeed_LF() {
162 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
163 		final String expected = "package foo;\n"
164 				+ "\n"
165 				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n"
166 				+ "			       A,\n"
167 				+ "				   B,\n"
168 				+ "				   C\n"
169 				+ "}";
170 
171 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, Settings.getLineFeed("\\n", System.getProperty("line.separator")), null, null);
172 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
173 	}
174 
175 	@Test
176 	public void testFormatUsingLinefeed_CRLF() {
177 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
178 		final String expected = "package foo;\r\n"
179 				+ "\r\n"
180 				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\r\n"
181 				+ "			       A,\r\n"
182 				+ "				   B,\r\n"
183 				+ "				   C\r\n"
184 				+ "}";
185 
186 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, Settings.getLineFeed("\\r\\n", System.getProperty("line.separator")), null, null);
187 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
188 	}
189 
190 	@Test
191 	public void testFormatSourceLevel_1dot3() {
192 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
193 		final String expected = null;
194 
195 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, Settings.getLineFeed("\\n", System.getProperty("line.separator")), "1.3", null);
196 		Assert.assertEquals("Invalid source code for 1.3 - enum is not a keyword", expected, actual);
197 	}
198 
199 	@Test
200 	public void testFormatSourceLevel_1dot4() {
201 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
202 		final String expected = null;
203 
204 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, Settings.getLineFeed("\\n", System.getProperty("line.separator")), "1.4", null);
205 		Assert.assertEquals("Invalid source code for 1.4 - enum is not a keyword", expected, actual);
206 	}
207 
208 	@Test
209 	public void testFormatSourceLevel_1dot5() {
210 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
211 		final String expected = "package foo;\n"
212 				+ "\n"
213 				+ "public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n"
214 				+ "			       A,\n"
215 				+ "				   B,\n"
216 				+ "				   C\n"
217 				+ "}";
218 
219 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/org.eclipse.jdt.core.prefs", null, text, Settings.getLineFeed("\\n", System.getProperty("line.separator")), "1.5", null);
220 		Assert.assertEquals("Invalid source code for 1.4 - enum is not a keyword", expected, actual);
221 	}
222 
223 	@Test
224 	public void testNullProfile() {
225 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
226 
227 		try {
228 			instance.format("src/test/resources/formattersampleeclipse.xml", null, text, null, null, null);
229 		} catch (ProfileNotFoundException e) {
230 			Assert.assertEquals(true, e.getMessage().contains("Profile null not found"));
231 		}
232 	}
233 
234 	@Test
235 	public void testNullFormatterConfig() {
236 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {A,B,C}";
237 		final String expected = "package foo;\n" +
238 				"\n" +
239 				"public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {\n" +
240 				"    A, B, C\n" +
241 				"}";
242 
243 		String actual = instance.format(null, null, text, null, null, null);
244 
245 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual.replaceAll("\r", ""));
246 	}
247 
248 	@Test
249 	public void testProfileNotFound() {
250 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
251 
252 		try {
253 			instance.format("src/test/resources/formattersampleeclipse.xml", "myProfile", text, null, null, null);
254 		} catch (ProfileNotFoundException e) {
255 			Assert.assertEquals(true, e.getMessage().contains("Profile myProfile not found"));
256 		}
257 	}
258 
259 	@Test
260 	public void testNoProfileInConfig() {
261 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
262 
263 		try {
264 			instance.format("src/test/resources/defectformattersampleeclipse.xml", "myProfile", text, null, null, null);
265 		} catch (ConfigReadException e) {
266 			Assert.assertEquals(true, e.getMessage().contains("No <profiles> tag found in config file"));
267 		}
268 	}
269 
270 	@Test
271 	public void testCannotLoadConfigFound() {
272 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest { A, B, C}";
273 
274 		try {
275 			instance.format("src/test/resources/notexistent.xml", "myProfile", text, null, null, null);
276 		} catch (CannotLoadConfigurationException e) {
277 			Assert.assertEquals(true, e.getMessage().contains("src/test/resources/notexistent.xml"));
278 		}
279 	}
280 
281 	@Test
282 	public void testNullCode() {
283 		final String expected = null;
284 
285 		String actual = instance.format("src/test/resources/formattersampleeclipse.xml", "eclipse-demo", null, null, null, null);
286 		Assert.assertEquals("Formatting should change the code", expected, actual);
287 	}
288 
289 	@Test
290 	public void testIllegalChangedElementsCode() {
291 		final String text = "package foo;public enum NewEmptyJUnitTest {A,B,C}";
292 
293 		SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> regions = new TreeSet<>();
294 		regions.add(Pair.of(1200, 1230));
295 
296 		try {
297 			instance.format("src/test/resources/formattersampleeclipse.xml", "eclipse-demo", text, null, null, regions);
298 
299 			Assert.assertFalse("Should have thrown an IllegalArgumentException", true);
300 		} catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
301 			Assert.assertTrue(true);
302 		}
303 	}
304 }
